Posts.Content: Just to add, when Holland and Barratt last had their £ sale  I got manuka honey there so it worked out cheaper. Dont know if their sale is still on or not.
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: Hot water with squeeze of lemon, manuka honey and hot ribena helped me with the dry throat and sore tongue etc. good luck, it will pass like all the other niggly things.
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: I chose to forego the strong painkillers as they can constipate and I didn't fancy that. Yes it was painful but it didn't hang around for too long and once it past it was ok. Hang in there Jan!  Shaz, r your eyelashes/eyebrows back yet after 10 weeks?  k
Posts.Title: Aches and pains with Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Shaz,  I'm doing well, recovering from surgery tho still got drain in.  My last chemo was beg January and I've got white downy stuff on my head but no lashes/brows apart from the few that didn't drop out.
Posts.Title: Aches and pains with Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi jazz shampoo  i had the same op 5 weeks ago, 22 nodes removed. I've been doing exercises daily apart from last few days as I'm more mobile now and using my arm more, but this morning I noticed that my arm was tender on the inside flat part, it hurt to touch it. I read on here someone saying to swing the arm if u feel sore or stiff and I did that. - it helped immediately I couldn't believe it. Just a tip, it might be helpful.
Posts.Title: Lump in the arm

Posts.Content: I'm 3 months past chemo and find my nails r getting worse! They're so brittle and keep splitting low down. My toe nails r bad too, so today I bought some nutra nail mineral collection Iron strength from the chemist, hope it works.
Posts.Title: Bruised Toe Nails

Posts.Content: my last tax was 5 weeks ago but I find my arms and legs are still aching. Not needing to take pain killers but eg I notice if I hold the phone to my ear for too long I feel it in my arm. Stretching is hard, it's like my muscles contract afterwards and its very painful for a few seconds. Just wondering how long this can last for.Thank u.
Posts.Title: Still aching after last tax 5 weeks ago

Posts.Content: What wonderful testimonies in this thread. I've definitely come closer to many friends, family relations and work colleagues.  I've touched my own depth and felt closer than ever to my spiritual self. On a lighter note I started 'war and peace' at the start of chemo and have just finished it! I've always wanted to read it so now I can tick that one off my to do list :-))
Posts.Title: Can good things come from having Cancer?

Posts.Content: I juice a raw carrot, beetroot and apple every day if I can.
Posts.Title: Post BC Treatment Low Immune System.

Posts.Content: Thanks jives, I will be patient, I'm sure it will improve soon.
Posts.Title: Still aching after last tax 5 weeks ago

Posts.Content: Hi g & j they were going for an educated guess. Unknown primary is not that common but on this website it says could be due to body already thrown it out, fought it off so I'm taking it positively as all the scans I've done don't show anything anywhere else.  The pains r not so bad that I need painkillers, I take the line less is more when it comes to that unless its really bad. My body is reminding me when I've done too much which isn't a bad thing!
Posts.Title: Still aching after last tax 5 weeks ago

Posts.Content: just wondered what people use for scars. I haven't touched my scar and its 4 weeks tomorrow since the op -  I'd like to help the skin healing along. thanks and best wishes to all. Xx
Posts.Title: Cream for scar

Posts.Content: Hi Shaz, some people use the chillow. I've not got one tho am getting hot flushes in the night and some nights am constantly throwing duvet off then on then off etc. When I wake up I'm all over the bed. Hubby sleeps elsewhere as he's the same but for different reasons as he's on dialysis and very restless. I've seen them for sale on Amazon. Let us know what works for u in the end. X
Posts.Title: night sweats

Posts.Content: Hi tej can u give me the full name of the Argonne product as I've searched on Amazon and cant find it. Was it you who also said u put it on eyelashes and brows to help growth? I'm getting a bit lost in all these posts! thank u kate
Posts.Title: Cream for scar

Posts.Content: Now that my hair is growing back I'm also noticing lots of extra hair on my face including end of my nose! i know there have been a few posts about this kind of thing but I was wondering if anyone knows whether the hair will brush off eventually or if it's another permanent side effect of the chemo. Might it even be due to menopause setting in, also side effect? Best wishes to all xx
Posts.Title: Hairy face

Posts.Content: I found this website v helpful freemeditation.com for meditation. The thinking tires us out more than anything else and there's a v simple technique to stop the thoughts. Give it a go, u might find it helps xx
Posts.Title: Insomnia help please

Posts.Content: Hi genny glad u r better this time round. I used to get constipated on the fec, one of the anti sickness drugs did that. Senna, hot water, prune juice (the natural one) and a bit of walking if u can manage may also help. Be careful not to take too much Senna as u might get cramps. I took Senna throughout the chemo to keep everything moving as its a horrible feeling otherwise. Good luck! kate x
Posts.Title: Post 1st chemo!

Posts.Content: Wonderful posts, I'm determined to be a positive person when I'm through, even now I'm trying. Best to laugh and see the positive in everything, 'lighten up' is my new motto!
Posts.Title: Happy and you know it...

Posts.Content: Hi genny, you poor thing, it sounds so uncomfortable. I went off the taste of water so mixed it with Ribena and drank gallons of it, maybe you will find that helps. And of course prune juice...Senna etc. I was constipated as well but at the end of the day I just waited untill things moved and had to be patient. There was another discussion on here about a week or 2 ago with some other tips if u can find it.
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: Hi genny, you poor thing, it sounds so uncomfortable. I went off the taste of water so mixed it with Ribena and drank gallons of it, maybe you will find that helps. And of course prune juice...Senna etc. I was constipated as well but at the end of the day I just waited untill things moved and had to be patient. There was another discussion on here about a week or 2 ago with some other tips if u can find it.
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: Yes I am. I'm 2 months past chemo.  I was thinking its early menopause symptoms bought on by chemo. I've got some hair now but still keep beanie on tho have to whip it off as soon as flush starts, then body temp drops straight after and I'm cold!
Posts.Title: hot flush or just because I am bald

Posts.Content: I'm going to leave mine and keep triming the ends when it's long enough. They say chemo stays in the system for 6-12 months so I suppose r hair will continue to carry the toxins all this time as well. Good luck ladies whatever u do!
Posts.Title: Hair - again

Posts.Content: Soooo nice, enjoy the love!
Posts.Title: Just had a nice surprise

Posts.Content: Hi Liz, I've heard about that and of course in other cultures they shave childrens hair at one year old to make it stronger. Mine is also growing back and it's very fine anyway so if someone told me it would be stronger if I shaved it again then I would but I'm getting fed up with being Mrs potato head and want it to grow now. I didn't find the shaving bit too bad at the time but watching it grow back so slowly is harder. Sorry for rambling xx ps just got a call that drain is coming out today :-)
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: I agree this T is quite an ordeal. I had my last one 3 weeks ago but am feeling totally wiped out. They say that the build up will hit u at the end and boy has it. I have to take the stairs v slowly, aches in legs and arms but on the plus side food taste is improving and head hair growing back.  Sarah, I think your hubby and family will have to be patient for a while longer!
Posts.Title: Rotting away

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I don't use shampoo at all, without any hair I don't see what the use is. I rub neals yard almond oil into my scalp at least twice a day even tho my hair is starting to come back, that's enough for me. I'm looking forward to eyelashes/brows as much as hair, perhaps even more. Take care.
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: I've got all my finger nails and none have turned black but I've got 2 black toe nails. Tomorrow is my 6th and last T so looks like I may have got away with it as well. Also, I've noticed some fluff on my scalp, don't know if I'll lose it again or if it's the first signs of growth. Hoping for thicker hair this time around as my hair was so fine and thin on top anyway, this could be my chance to get a nice head of hair at last!
Posts.Title: Nail growth ...

Posts.Content: Try a bath with Epsom salts before bedtime, very relaxing and got me to sleep like a baby last night. X
Posts.Title: Today has been a blurrrr

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I've done 3xFEC and 1xT which was about 2 weeks ago, I have my second T next week. The side effects from T were aches and pains throughout my body although that may also have been due to the zarzio injections. But I also felt the 'thing' much more than ever, and still am, and I can't tell if its breaking up or the opposite. The FEC had no effect on it. Has anyone experienced this? Take care everyone Xx
Posts.Title: Can't tell if its growing or shrinking

Posts.Content: Hi Emma, I've just googled your story and Alfie! How amazing :-) once I saw a lady on tv who said her dog found the cancer in her, aren't animals wonderful. i love your posts (read the other one too) as they're so positive and encouraging. I've nothing more to add so new2this if u read this know that everyone is here to support u and we're all survivors and so will u be. Xx
Posts.Title: does anybody talk here?

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm interested to know if anyone has had RT to the neck and if you had any side effects from it. Thanks.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy at neck

Posts.Content: I've noticed more lines around my nose/mouth due to dehyration and I'm moisturising like crazy now. Went to a look good feel good session and they gave some v nice skin products . Also went into space nk which is way over my budget but got some fab samples and am now tempted! Don't do anything drastic, wait and see how your skin goes after chemo, it will be less dehydrated. We will all return to our beautiful selves and be better stronger people for surviving this which for me is what it's all about. Big hugs, xx
Posts.Title: What chemo does to facial skin

Posts.Content: Thanks mistymoley, that's good to hear. kate
Posts.Title: Can't tell if its growing or shrinking

Posts.Content: Hi crystaljuju I had a ct scan after the first 3 FEC and it showed no change. But, what I'm feeling now is different to before and I think it's to do with the T chemo. I'm seeing the oncologist next week but won't have a acan until I've done 3 x T. have a good day, x
Posts.Title: Can't tell if its growing or shrinking

Posts.Content: Thanks amylou. I'm meeting an onc tonight for a second opinion so this will prepare me as I expect they will want to give me RT there as well as breast. I know what u mean about side effects kicking in after treatment, I'm finding that 3 months post chemo. All the best. Kate
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy at neck

Posts.Content: My last chemo was 2 weeks ago but now my nails are feeling weird as if they're being pinched! They're also a bit yellow, has anyone else had this?
Posts.Title: Weird nails

Posts.Content: Oh no, I thought I'd got away with just one black toe nail :-( the base of my nails is already darker since this morning. I will get some nail oil as u recommend Gillie. Yes, glad to have got through the chemo but still have surgery and rads to go... xx
Posts.Title: Weird nails

Posts.Content: had surgery on Monday and all went well. Decided to stay 2 nights just to be able to go home stronger and so glad I did.  Last time I was in hospital was when I had my babies in my 20s and couldn't wait to be home and get on but 25 years later it's not like that and peaceful recovery is what counts. Great care here, thank u NHS
Posts.Title: Hi from barts

Posts.Content: Mixed day today but on a positive note my eyes have not been sore or watering at all which is a first in a long while :-) . I've been researching lymphedema and risks once u have nodes removed and am feeling anxious about that.
Posts.Title: how u all doin ?

Posts.Content: Hi Caroline, thank u for sharing that. As my lump is on a lymph node they will remove up to 20 nodes they say so it is a bit scary. They may also have to cut the nerve under the arm but another lady on the forum has told me that it's not so bad and doesn't affect her. Kate x
Posts.Title: how u all doin ?

Posts.Content: Thank u G and J, I've had a read of the leaflet which is very helpful, much appreciated. Kate
Posts.Title: how u all doin ?

Posts.Content: Yes it does seems like u have been having a rough time, it's good u have joined this group if only to have a rant and let it off your chest. The tax is different to fec in that for most of us there's no sickness or nausea but u get muscular skeletal pains which kick in after a few days and last a few days as well. I suppose u r watching your diet and eating well for the constipation, I used to get that and still do so I take senakot and also laxido from gp. Have u tried manuka honey for the mouth sores? It helped me and u will also get mouth sores during tax. Stressing about it makes us worse and some people have posted about relaxation techniques that can help. I go to a website freemeditation.com which is great and u can learn at home, don't have to attend a class. I hope these tips help u a bit, is your bcn helpful? Take care x
Posts.Title: chemo side effects

Posts.Content: Hi curvy sorry to see that u r having such a tough time. Yes it's all horrible and the side effects can be dreadful. What side effects r u having? Share them with us and maybe we can give u some tips to get through them. I had 3 fec and 3 tax and finished in January sodon't suffer in silence, u can get through this! Cyber hug xx
Posts.Title: chemo side effects

Posts.Content: Well I haven't bought any yet but took a bath in Epsom salts yday which was nice, it def got me off to sleep very fast, I'd recommend it to anyone who has sleep problems. They claim to detox and relax the body.
Posts.Title: Glucosamine?

Posts.Content: good morning all, I'd like to know if anyone is taking glucosamine for joint aches etc. I've read a bit online and know that this works for joint aches and pains but will it work on chemo related pains? Rose hip is also recommended by some. All the best.
Posts.Title: Glucosamine?

Posts.Content: Hello ladies I'm the opposite, I have to remind myself that I've got this 'thing' some days as I feel so normal apart from the fact that I'm putting on weight! Don't know if it's the meds or simply being at home and not dashing off to work every day! Hope it comes off at the end of this ordeal a bit. I find that if I get in first with a question peopl r happy to talk about themselves and this steers the conversation away from me. Xx
Posts.Title: Fed up of cancer being the focus ...

Posts.Content: Well done for getting this far without injections! They gave me 5 to take after every tax but my husband gave them to me. As long as u inject where there is some fat then u won't feel a thing. Enjoy your pj DVD day and only one more to go hurrah! X
Posts.Title: Omg injecting myself arghhh !!!

Posts.Content: Hello scribbling lady, it's so true about giving yourself time to heal. I had surgery 5 weeks ago and although I thought I was doing well last few weeks I can c how much better I am now compared to then. They say to give about 6 weeks to recover and its v true. I'm just so thankful that my work is keeping me on full pay and I don't have to rush back. I've still got radiotherapy to go as well probably. Take it easy, doing too much now can make it worse and u might risk lymphdema.
Posts.Title: Feels as if I am going backwards a bit

Posts.Content: Spenfold, I've put on at least a stone since September as well I'm glad I made u laugh! I think that my eating habits are just returning to normal and I'm not looking for things to take away weird tastes etc. once I become active again then I might lose a bit. At the end of the day it's not important compared to everything else we r dealing with but it's annoying on top of bald head and pasty complexion!!   Littlesusie, I used to inject my husband no prob but it's doing it to myself that makes me squirm. Good luck with the pills and remember manuka honey - worked for me instead of mouthwash. xx
Posts.Title: Omg injecting myself arghhh !!!

Posts.Content: Very funny! I can relate to some of the symptoms before chemo so I'm not totally convinced. A few years ago when my husband was dialysing at home I used to set the machine up with loads of tubes and buttons but I couldn't do that now, and if I had to I would be v v slow and unsure. My attention is much worse these days, even when I want to look up a reply or a thread on this forum I can't remember where it was!! Do u think a return to work can help or hinder this?
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain - Er' Now Where Was I :-)

Posts.Content: School admin, busy job but I  work with good people who have been very supportive while I've been off.
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain - Er' Now Where Was I :-)

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, These posts made me smile a lot! My first T was rough and I felt beaten up for about 4 days. When I saw the onc she prescribed cocodamol for the next time but I didn't need it! Also it does constipate and I didn't want to deal with that too. Not sure if I was just better prepared mentally or my body coped better but my last chemo was far easier. I've got my 6th and last one next week. I thought I'd be feeling good about that but I don't feel anything now, really weird, but I feel kind of numb about it all. Xx
Posts.Title: 5th chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Jeanette, Mine came out after first FEC but it started to grow back with the T.  I have only put neals yard organic almond oil on it and still do even though it's growing back, and massage my scalp when I put it on. I have one wig, a couple of beanies from boldbeanies website and a few woolly hats. Good luck, it's not all that bad and it's very easy to manage once it's gone xx
Posts.Title: Hair Care before and after Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I put olive oil in my nose when it becomes dry - might be helpful to anyone reading this! Xx
Posts.Title: Nose

Posts.Content: I used to find hot Ribena tasted ok and helped with the dry mouth/sore throat.
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Was being so careful and doing arm exercises so diligently but today my upper arm near armpit feels tight. It's different to just swelling feeling. I may have overdone it yesterday as was ok up untill now. I've called my bcn this afternoon but she hasn't got back to me. I'm not sure how much I should be doing my exercises now, can anyone advise as I don't want to overdo it either and make it worse.  Thank u.
Posts.Title: Tight arm feeling

Posts.Content: Went to barts to get it checked and its scar tissue not fluid. If there is any fluid its minimal and the body should absorb it. Will continue to keep using it and exercising, to say I'm relieved is an understatement
Posts.Title: Swollen arm/breast is it normal?

Posts.Content: Hi liz, sorry to hear you have same kind of issue. Have u continued with your exercises or stopped? I've just done a few and it feels good while I do them but I don't want to overdo it either. In some ways I felt better during the chemo as it was more predictable and I felt like I was on a roll, but with this its something to watch indefinitely. It may sound strange to say this but it's how I feel at the moment, tomorrow is a new day and I will probably feel better.  Good luck for tomorrow.Best wishes Kate
Posts.Title: Tight arm feeling

Posts.Content: There's no rope feeling, it's just tight and my shirt sleeve is a bit tighter compared to my left arm. I can actually move my right arm fairly well although it isn't straight. My under arm and armpit is still numb.
Posts.Title: Tight arm feeling

Posts.Content: This morning I noticed how different in size my right breast and under armpit/arm is compared to my left side. I feel it all the time like when I hang my arm down against my body it is different to my left side and doesn't go flat against me. is this normal, surgery was 2 months ago or should I be concerned? Movement in the right arm is pretty good tho it's always tender when I get up in the mornings.  Don't want to be moaning all the time but I got a bit of a shock just now when I looked in the mirror. Oh and also have had pain for days in left neck/shoulder as I'm using left arm more than before to compensate for right side :-(( Otherwise things are ok and sun is shining! Xx
Posts.Title: Swollen arm/breast is it normal?

Posts.Content: Thanks all for your replies. I'm doing exercises every day incl the ones I got given after surgery. Not had RT yet, may have next month. Going to call bcn to arrange visit as I feel really down about it today, somehow its got to me and I'm not liking the new me that can't do half as much as she used to. Xx
Posts.Title: Swollen arm/breast is it normal?

Posts.Content: I do those lumosity brain gym games on my iPad, when I can remember to do them! One of my best friends said to me yesterday that I was much slower than I used to be but you know it's not such a bad thing, I used to be too speedy, I'm taking in the little things in life more.  for me it's remembering conversations and with whom and what decisions may have been made that gets me, when I return to work after RT I can see that's going to be fun!!
Posts.Title: chemo fog

Posts.Content: Hi Liz how did your appt go? Does the arm feel better? I've been doing lots of exercises and mine has improved. I've got surgeon appt this afternoon and will also discuss arm.  All the best, Kate
Posts.Title: Tight arm feeling

Posts.Content: Hi Helen hope the headache has gone now or at least eased off. I had a bad headache after my first Fec and just waited for it to pass which it did. I didn't get any headaches again throughout rest of chemo so u may not get again either
Posts.Title: Headaches after first FEC -t

Posts.Content: Hello i've been given 5 x zarzio injections to take and have done 4 so far. My body feels like it's been beaten up, aches all over And stiffening up. Has anyone else had this experience? Did u do anything to relieve it? x
Posts.Title: Zarzio

Posts.Content: Hi Petrina thanks for replying. I finished my 5 injection yesterday so will wait to see.  I hope you are doing well and the outcome from the surgery was the best. xx
Posts.Title: Zarzio

Posts.Content: Hi all, I met the surgeon today and it was mixed news. They've been treating a lump near my armpit as breast cancer but the primary site is still not known which is a good thing they say. Basically the cancer is in a lymph node so she is going to remove the 4.5cm lump and up to 15 nodes and may have to cut the nerve under my arm as well - she won't know until she 'in'. I had 3 x FEC that didn't shrink it but the 3xT did a bit. I've signed the paper for the operation but now the questions and concerns are setting in. I'm concerned at the removal of so many nodes and the risk of lymphodema as well as movement in the arm and cording etc. has anyone had something similar, how have u managed, please let me know. thank u.
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi dendy Yes was v relieved about arm.  I love doing exercises as arm feels so good when stretched. First I had chemo, then surgery where they took out 22 nodes and all were normal and I didn't have masectomy. I don't have breast cancer as my primary site was and still is unknown. The unknown primary group is very quiet so I joined this group as onc is treating me like breast cancer. I'm seeing the radiologist on Monday. I may post a new discussion in case there r any other unknown primary ladies here who r similar to me. All the best, keep it up and u will be ok. x
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Avi1766 and jo thanks for replying, it's so helpful and reassuring to know others have had the same and are coping.  Kate xx
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Thanks mrs c, very useful advice and nice to hear that you and Sally are doing so well :-) They've given me the option of staying the night in hospital which I'm inclined to do even though I love my own bed. They've told me about drains but I've not seen a picture, I will look for one online so that I can see what it will be like.
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Thank u ladies, all your info is very helpful. Perhaps if it shrunk more then they wouldn't need to remove so many nodes, I will ask my bcn if one more chemo would do that as much as I would dread that it may be better in the long run.    this forum is great isn't it, your replies have given me a boost and much needed company. Kate xx
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi dendy im also obsessed as my op was 4 weeks ago so know how u feel. I do my exercises religiously. I had a scare this week as arm felt different but it's ok now. Surgeon wants me to have radiotherapy on the site although they've taken 22 nodes out and rads will increase my risk of lymphedema. Did anyone else here have full node removal and radiotherapy? Best wishes.
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: What's B&m? Green and black dark for me please!
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: Now that is awesome- not a word I use much as I think it's used too freely these days but cant think of another adjective - thanks for sharing :-)
Posts.Title: Positive news

Posts.Content: Absolutely wonderful, its great to share the joy xx
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: Hi comper, I've just completed 6 chemo sessions FECT to shrink a tumour and will have scan in a few weeks followed by surgery, so I'm ahead of u. Don't know about radiotherapy yet.  After the initial shock things do improve although it's always there. Good luck, u will cope and well done for going into work. I did continue to work on and off after the initial news as it was summer holidays and I work in a school so it was quiet, but once treatment started I was signed off.   xx
Posts.Title: Results of scans

Posts.Content: Oh no I feel for u especially when u were all psyched up for it, must have been a faulty one!
Posts.Title: Epic fail lol
